result.execSummary:
The defendant Lora G. Larson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: $290.60 fine/costs to be paid to Probation while on Probation. Fines/costs to be taken out of bond that was posted. If not paid in full, to be taken out of prison wages. If not paid in full after Probation a civil judgment will be entered on behalf of Polk County. Any bond left over to be returned to poster.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.

Cannot vote until civil rights are restored, cannot hold elective office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, if not a U.S. Citizen may face deportation. 
No illegal substances. 
No contact with Lance Arthurs or any other convicted person with drug offenses unless prior approval by Probation Agent.
Must complete a COMPAS Evaluation and follow through. Must remain sober. Must complete treatment if deemed appropriate.

supervisions.notes: Probation may petition court for early release if deem necessary.

Concurrent with: 14CF170 Count 1
Consecutive to: 15CF182 Count 1 and 14CF160 Count 1

records.addlTxt:
CASES: 13CF202, 14CF169, 14CF152, 15CF31, 14CF170, 14CF153, 14CF162, 15CF182 & 14CF160. Defendant Lora G Larson in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 3:28 pm.  Exh 1-Restitution Order.  State's argument 3:38 pm.  Defense's argument 4:18 pm.  JB-clerk 4:20pm.  Def addresses CT. Off the record 4:33pm   Back on the record 4:45pm.  No restitution to be ordered-30 days if DA can clarify. Elig for SA program. No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold public office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen may face deportation. 

SENTENCE:
14CF160: 8 yrs - 4 yrs ic/4 yrs es; sentence credit 219; $290.60 fine/costs, DNA sample (only one)-no surcharge

14CF170: W/H sent-probation for 3 yrs consecutive to CT 1 14CF160 and 15CF182 file; sent credit 217 if revoked; $290.60 fine/costs

15CF182: CT 1: 5 yrs - 2 yrs ic/3 yrs es - consecutive to CT 2; 
                  CT 2: W/H sent - prob 3 yrs - concur with CT 170 file, consecutive to 15CF182 CT 1 and 14CF160 CT 1; if probation thinks that early discharge is fine need to petition Court; 136 days sentence credit; $290.60 fine/costs

14CF162: deferred case, 219 days sent credit if ever questioned. 

COMPAS and follow recommendations, remain sober, no illegal substances, treatment deemed appropriate, no contact with Lance Arthurs or any convicted person with drug offense unless prior approval by Probation Agent; court fines/costs to be taken from any bond that is posted, to be taken out of prison wages, if any fees left after probation may be reduced to civil judgment, any bond left over from paying fines may be returned to poster. PCR. adj 5:43pm
from DOC to JLA re PSI

Def called, said she had a hearing 8/28 at 9 AM was late and waiting for a ride. Court files indicate next hearing 9/11 at 2 PM. Informed def - she asked that a note be added to files that she had called and intended on appearing if date was supposed to be 8/28.
Sentencing hearing at 09-11-2015 02:00 pm
